solution.text:
\((6a+13y)^2-5(6a+13y)+6\)
Let \(x=6a+13y\)
\(=x^2-5x+6\)
Notice that \(x^2-5x+6\,\) can be written as \(x^2+(-2-3)x+(-2)(-3)\)
Using identity \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(=(x-2)(x-3)\)
Now substitute \(x\,\) for \(6a+13y\)
\(=(6a+13y-2)(6a+13y-3)\)

hint.text:
Remember that some algebraic expressions can be factorized using identities. These are some common identities :
\(a^2+2ab+b^2=(a+b)^2\)
\(a^2-2ab+b^2=(a-b)^2\)
\(a^2-b^2=(a+b)(a-b)\)
\(a^3-b^3=(a-b)(a^2+ab+b^2)\)
\(a^3+b^3=(a+b)(a^2-ab+b^2)\)

Remember that \((x+a)(x+b)=x^2+(a+b)x+ab\)
For example:
\(x^2+13x+36\,\)can be written as \(x^2+(9+4)x+(9)(4)\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2+13x+36=(x+9)(x+4)\)

solution.text:
\(x^2+10x+24\)
Notice that \(x^2+10x+24\,\)can be written as \(x^2+(4+6)x+(4)(6)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2+(4+6)x+(4)(6)=(x+4)(x+6)\)

\(\Rightarrow x^2+13x+36=(x+9)(x+4)\)

solution.text:
\(y^2+15y+36\)
Notice that \(y^2+15y+36\,\)can be written as \(y^2+(3+12)y+(3)(12)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow y^2+(3+12)y+(3)(12)=(y+3)(y+12)\)

solution.text:
\(t^2+7t-18\)
Notice that \(t^2+7t-18\,\)can be written as \(t^2+(9-2)t+9(-2)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow t^2+(9-2)t+9(-2)=(t+9)(t-2)\)

solution.text:
\(s^2-4s-60\)
Notice that \(s^2-4s-60\,\)can be written as \(s^2+(6-10)s+6(-10)\,\)
Using identity : \(x^2+(a+b)x+ab=(x+a)(x+b)\)
\(\Rightarrow s^2+(6-10)s+6(-10)=(s+6)(s-10)\)

Remember that some algebraic expressions can be factorized using identities. These are some common identities :
\(a^2+2ab+b^2=(a+b)^2\)
\(a^2-2ab+b^2=(a-b)^2\)
\(a^2-b^2=(a+b)(a-b)\)

Try and use the method completing the perfect square
For example :
\(a^2+8a+15\)
\(=a^2+8a+4^2-4^2+15\,\)[Adding and subtracting \(4^2\)]
\(=a^2+(2)(a)(4)+4^2-1\)
\(=(a+4)^2-1\)
Now use the identity \(a^2-b^2=(a-b)(a+b)\)
\(=(a+4-1)(a+4+1)\)
\(=(a+3)(a+5)\)
